session.objective: Research and incorporate structured engineering knowledge set covering practices, principles, mindsets, and models

skillScriptsListed.Evidence: N/A - No GitHub operations needed for research task

usageMandatoryRead.Evidence: Content in context - usage-mandatory memory read

constraintsRead.Evidence: N/A - Research task does not modify constraints

serenaMemoryUpdated.Evidence: Created 9 Serena memories for foundational knowledge

qaRouted.Evidence: SKIPPED: investigation-only - only created documentation and memories

activities: Performed web searches for 9 mental models (Chesterton's Fence, Hyrum's Law, Conway's Law, Second-Order Thinking, Law of Demeter, Gall's Law, YAGNI, Technical Debt Quadrant, Boy Scout Rule)
Researched 7 engineering principles (SOLID, DRY, KISS, Separation of Concerns, Tell Don't Ask, Programming by Intention, Design to Interfaces)
Researched 8 engineering practices (TDD, Pair Programming, Code Reviews, Refactoring, Clean Architecture, 12-Factor App, Trunk-Based Development, Observability)
Researched 5 architecture concepts (Hexagonal, Bounded Contexts, Event-Driven, CQRS, DORA Metrics)
Compiled resource reading list with 8 key references
Created comprehensive analysis document (3500+ words) at .agents/analysis/foundational-engineering-knowledge.md
Documented 9 mental models with origin, application, and examples
Documented 7 principles with practical application guidance
Documented 5 architecture patterns with when-to-use guidance
Included 8 self-reflection questions for thinking engineers
Created foundational-knowledge-index memory as central index
Created 8 new atomic memories for the mental models (excluding the pre-existing Chesterton's Fence memory)
Ensured memories are searchable for future sessions

context.trigger: User /research command for foundational engineering knowledge
context.scope: Comprehensive knowledge set: 9 mental models, 7 principles, 8 practices, 5 architecture concepts, 8 resources

decisions.decision: No GitHub issue needed for this research
decisions.rationale: Foundational knowledge is reference documentation. Chesterton's Fence integration already exists (Issue #748). Remaining concepts are educational guidance, not implementation tasks.

artifacts.description: Comprehensive 3500+ word analysis covering 9 mental models, 7 principles, 8 practices, 5 architecture patterns, reading list, and self-reflection questions
Index to all foundational knowledge memories
Hyrum's Law: all observable behavior becomes contract
Conway's Law: systems mirror org structure
Law of Demeter: only talk to friends
YAGNI: build only what's needed now
Technical Debt Quadrant: prudent vs reckless, deliberate vs inadvertent
Boy Scout Rule: leave code cleaner
